summary: This is a protective order issued by Judge Richard M. Berman regarding the handling of sensitive documents in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It outlines restrictions on the dissemination of discovery materials to protect privacy, ongoing investigations, and prevent prejudicial pretrial publicity.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, subject to the protective order's restrictions on handling discovery materials.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Issued the protective order governing the handling of sensitive materials in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Represented the government in the case and agreed to the terms of the protective order.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney for Jeffrey Epstein who consented to the protective order.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Attorney for Jeffrey Epstein who consented to the protective order.

connections.description: Martin Weinberg is listed as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in this protective order.
Reid Weingarten is listed as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in this protective order.
Judge Berman issued the protective order governing Epstein's case.

events.title: Protective Order Agreement
events.description: The protective order was agreed and consented to by the parties involved in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

locations.context: The protective order was issued by the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The protective order restricts the dissemination of sensitive documents to protect privacy and ongoing investigations.
Jeffrey Epstein's defense team is required to handle discovery materials under strict confidentiality rules.
The order prohibits public disclosure of materials that could lead to prejudicial pretrial publicity.
The protective order was agreed to by both the government and Epstein's defense counsel on July 24, 2019.
